overview: TCB is a 1968 television special produced by Motown Productions and George Schlatterâ€“Ed Friendly Productions of Laugh-In fame. The special is a musical revue starring Motown's two most popular groups at the time, Diana Ross & the Supremes and The Temptations. Containing a combination of showtunes, specially prepared numbers, and popular Motown hits, the special was taped before a live studio audience in September 1968 and originally broadcast December 9, 1968 on NBC, sponsored by the Timex watch corporation. The title of the program uses a then-popular acronym, "TCB", which stands for "Taking Care of Business".
tagline: The Supremes, and The Temptations sing their greatest hits of the 60s plus some unforgettable standards.
title: TCB
